function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Proximity of green spaces to the place of residence affecting frequency and popularity may lead to overcrowding and increased risk of contagious disease transmission.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Usage of green spaces located in the city centre indicates willingness to cover larger distances, leading to increased movement and potential spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Avoidance of green spaces during different phases of the covid-19 pandemic indicates concerns about disease transmission and may lead to reduced outdoor activity and social isolation.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Visits to green spaces potentially contribute to the spread of contagious diseases like covid-19.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Compliance with governmental mobility restrictions leading to reduced visits to green spaces.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relaxed budget policies may lead to a lack of financial resources for long-term public health infrastructure and preparedness, creating vulnerability to future disease outbreaks.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large-scale financial aid aims to support businesses and affected individuals, but may inadvertently lead to economic disparities, potentially exacerbating social determinants of health and widening health inequities.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of airborne disease transmission due to inadequate ventilation and air filtration.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential leakage of exhaust air back into the air supply due to energy recovery ventilation systems.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited availability and maintenance of HVAC systems in resource-limited settings, and neglect in resource-rich settings, can lead to ineffective room air disinfection.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitations of natural ventilation due to building design, sub-optimal practice, closed windows, and variable wind direction and speed.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rise in rebreathed air fraction (RAF) due to closing windows and using ductless air conditioning, leading to increased risk of airborne infection.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of germicidal ultraviolet (GUV) air disinfection leading to unchecked viral spread in the built environment.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential development of drug-resistant pathogens due to inadequate disinfection measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Analysis of the economic impact of the pandemic on supply chains and SMEs.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of VOSviewer software to analyze co-occurrence of keywords.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increasing ventilation rate in buildings reduces the number of infected people but increases HVAC energy consumption.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reducing class duration may result in a reduction of 49.6% in the number of infected people with COVID-19.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The study identifies the impact of occupants, air exchange rate, class duration, and working hours on energy consumption and COVID-19 infection risk.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extending working hours of university buildings increases HVAC energy consumption and occupant presence, impacting COVID-19 transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of occupant distribution on COVID-19 transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contagious disease propagation due to HVAC system malfunction or inefficiency.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty in accurately modeling COVID-19 virus infection due to indeterminate parameters and complex transmission mechanisms.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption by HVAC systems due to occupant density and variations in climate conditions.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Estimating COVID-19 infection risk based on virus quanta concentration and occupant density.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate HVAC system settings potentially contributing to disease transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Historical pandemics like cholera, typhoid, tuberculosis, and the third plague pandemic have influenced the design and infrastructure of the built environment, potentially contributing to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Homogeneity of results among the included studies.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Informal signs with handwritten and typed messages were used to communicate store closures and operating status.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Frequent changes to signs and their locations create potential confusion and inconsistency in communicating COVID-related information.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of traditional paper signs for COVID-related information limits the ability to dynamically update and adapt messaging in real-time.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid spread of COVID-19 in the built environment due to frequent behavioral changes and adjustments by retailers and consumers.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Photographing signs related to COVID-19 inside retail establishments may increase the risk of exposure to the virus for the person taking the photographs.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Frequent visits to grocery stores, pharmacies, and restaurants may increase the risk of exposure to COVID-19 due to potential contact with infected individuals or contaminated surfaces.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Classification of various establishments as ’retailers’ may overlook specific risks associated with different types of businesses, such as healthcare facilities and personal care services.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Close proximity of residential and commercial areas.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Extensive use of paper signs for conveying COVID-19 information.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited time to conduct research study involving interviews.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of informal signs may lead to incomplete or unclear communication.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited time and resources for retailers to react to COVID-19 guidelines resulted in challenges in implementing proper health and safety measures, potentially leading to the spread of contagious diseases within retail environments.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Prominent in-store signs and displays play a role in shaping consumer behavior and prompting particular actions. if used incorrectly, they may inadvertently encourage behaviors that contribute to the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-compliance with regulations for social distancing and closure of non-essential services.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Layoffs and remote work due to closure of non-essential services.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rapid change in social behaviors and habits.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Crowded places and non-essential gatherings.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of access to virtual reality technology in low-income countries due to high cost and computing power requirement.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Improperly adjusted head-mounted virtual reality devices causing blurry images and text.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"}, {"name":"Securing electronic medical records using blockchain.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"}, {"name":"Intrinsic experience in a safe virtual environment using blockchain.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Integrating point-of-care diagnostics for self-testing of COVID-19 patients in isolation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"}]}
